result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica J Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 01-31-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 9 months of initial confinement in count 1.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (06-13-2015) time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.

Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
Fine is set at ZERO.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.

supervisions.notes:
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request to vacate one of the DNA surcharges.

Attorney Robert N. Meyeroff in court, defendant Veronica J Moore not in court, in custody.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Jay Unora. Deputy Court Clerk:  AMI

Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by  counsel and petitioner's attorney.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order. Copies provided to the parties.

Attorney Robert N. Meyeroff in court.  Jay Unora appeared for City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: sm 
Held off the record. Case set for Return of property hearing  Parties request an adjournment. Case adjourned for return of property hearing on 05/27/2016 at 1:30pm, branch 17.  Return of property hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return of property hearing on April 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification, received, signed and filed. Copies mailed to the parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to run sentences concurrent.
Defendant's DOB was not in CCAP.  Now entered into CCAP.  Corrected JOC showing same.

Defendant Veronica J Moore in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (06-13-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 9 months of initial confinement. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 9 months of initial confinement in count 1. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 01-31-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Thirteen letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk
Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

AS TO COUNT 1 (as amended) and COUNT 2:  

The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  The Court advises the parties that any written statements as to sentencing must be filed THREE (3) business days before hearing date.  Sentencing date before Branch 17 selected with the parties. Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Offer email.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing before Branch 17 on 1-13-16 at 8:30 a.m.

CASE RECALLED....

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

On state's oral motion COUNT 1 AMENDED TO:

- POSSESSION OF COCAINE (2nd+), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41 (3g)(c) , a Class I FELONY

*COUNT 2 REMAINS THE SAME*

Sworn for the State: Eulia Kazachenko; Officer- Milwaukee Police Department. State rests. Case passed.
